The technology may not be accessible to all visually impaired users, as there are many different types and levels of visual impairment.
The technology may not be able to accurately recognize and interpret visual information, leading to incorrect or misleading information being provided to the user.
The technology may not be able to adapt to different environments or situations, making it difficult for the user to use it in a variety of settings.
The technology may be expensive and not affordable for all visually impaired individuals.
The technology may not be able to provide a complete solution for all visually impaired users, as some users may have additional disabilities or needs that are not addressed by the technology.
